fields.description: In an empty repo if you select "I already have some code" it suggests using {{git remote add origin ssh://}}, but when cloning via SSH after adding any content it uses the {{git@bitbucket.org}} syntax. This means that any repositories you create online but initialize locally will have a different remote which can be very confusing with those not comfortable with git.
fields.summary: In an empty repo the add remote doesn't match the clone url
Pull request with conflicts/errors that are merged using API returns unreadable error.

fields.description:
There has been a recent change in the Code Snippets API that no longer returns a value for files."foo.txt".links.self in the case of the API documentation.

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/snippets/%7Busername%7D/%7Bencoded_id%7D

This removal breaks jQuery implementations where users want to display the contents of the Code Snippet markup within their website.
fields.summary: Code Snipppets API not returning link to raw code

fields.description: I like the "Like" link on comments, so I'd like it to appear on the Pull Request Activity tab, not just the Overview tab as it does now.
fields.summary: "Like" link does not appear on Pull Request Activity tab

fields.description:
Since a few days ago some of our internal builds are failing due to an error that was quite hard to trace.\\
Our build script looks something like this:

# Init git settings (username, email)
# Get ssh-keys for both bitbucket.org and GitHub.com ({{ssh-keyscan -t rsa bitbucket.org}})
# Checkout code from Bitbucket

Now in 3. our builds would sometimes fail randomly saying "The authenticity of host 'bitbucket.org (...)' can't be established.".

When we were investigating this issue we've found out that {{ssh-keyscan -t rsa bitbucket.org}} doesn't get the key every time.\\
Instead sometimes it would simply return without any key at all:\\
!187056941-Screen%20Shot%202016-12-06%20at%2011.00.14.png|thumbnail!

Please make sure that your app servers actually return the ssh key so that we can use this (as documented here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-the-ssh-protocol-with-bitbucket-cloud-221449711.html) in our automated builds.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: ssh keys for bitbucket.org can not be retrieved reliably

fields.description:
We are seeing the below error trying to pull from any of our repos via https, for example https://jamiesellick93@bitbucket.org/keyagent/keyagent.git

List remote refs failed: java.net.ConnectException: Connection time out: bitbucket.org

SSH appears to be unaffected, but this error is manifesting via TeamCity, where we use HTTPS.
fields.summary: Git via HTTPS Timeout

fields.description:
When comparing image changes in commit and compare views, the split view's before and after images are misaligned on wide screens (i.e. larger than 1080px).

!4001720986-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Image diff split view is broken on wide screens

fields.description:
I'm on an Ubuntu server and unable to do git pull/ push, git clone through ssh or https, I get these errors:

ssh: ssh: Could not resolve hostname bitbucket.org: Temporary failure in name resolution\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.

https: fatal: unable to access 'https://thao0506@bitbucket.org/smartdevllc/oddohr.git/': Could not resolve host: bitbucket.org

How can I do anythings to resolve these errors ?
fields.summary: Could not resolve hostname bitbucket.org

fields.description:
I am working for Sharefile and we have company's bitbucket domain where I can login with company provided username and password. Same thing I want to do on Source tree too, But it has only one option to login i.e. via email id.

And while login via company credentials, it shows error; either email or password is incorrect.\\
Is there any way by which I can login with my company domain bitbucket account on Source tree ?

Thanks\\
Kumar Gaurav
fields.summary: Source Tree login with company domain

fields.description:
Relates to using reStructuredText in Wiki.

When creating a list, with subitems, and using text markup to make something bold, the following bug is observed:

* One level list — no problems
* One level list with subitems and bold text — no problems
* A list item, with some bold text, followed by a subitem — extra space is added above the subitem.

Here is the example code (see also screenshots):

{code}
List with subitems

* item 1 **with bold text**
* item 2

  * subitem 2.1
  * subitem **with some bold text** 2.2
* item 3
* item 4 **with bold text**
  
  * subitem 4.1
  * subitem 4.2
{code}
fields.summary: reStructuredText: list subitem after bold text

fields.description: My user is aicastell@thermesys.com, I'm trying to register but I don't receive the conformation email. This account works fine, I can send email from a gmail account without any issue. Thank you!
fields.summary: Not receiving confirmation email when trying to register my user account

fields.description: * The new webhooks feature tab, does not allow the use of IPv6.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not accept IPv6 addresses

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a snippet the default Permissions for the snippet is set to 'Public'. This can be easily overlooked by users who may forget to change for snippets they want to keep private.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the default Permission on snippet creation to Private (for individual accounts) / Team (for team accounts).

h3. Why this is important
Users may accidentally expose snippets meant to be Private/Team accessible (for team snippets) only.
fields.summary: Change default permissions in snippet creation to private - Customer Request

fields.description: The output on the pipeline log needs wrapping as there is no way to scroll to the right of it.
fields.summary: Add wrapping to output log

fields.description:
h1. Problem
In some instances, read only links in the webhooks panel are not removed when an add-on is uninstalled

h1. Cause
clean up job that removes stale hooks for add-ons that have been uninstalled needs to be fixed

h1. Resolution
Devs are working to have this process fixed by next Friday
fields.summary: Read only links in webhooks panel are not removed when the add-on is uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
bq. Forked repo can't be synced with main repo if we create a new branch in the main repo AFTER we do the fork.

The option of deleting forked repo and re-forking (even if it creates all the branches of our main repo to the team account) is not a viable solution\\
because:

# We again have this problem in the future if we added new release branch on our main repo. Then we have to keep deleting the forked repository from the account.
# We are using issue tracker on forked repo to manage issues and we can't afford to loose all issues and discussions around them in team accounts just because a new branch is added to the main repo.


h3. Resolution Suggested
Improve the Fork Sync feature to allow forked repository to sync newly created branch on the main repository

(BBS-44781)
fields.summary: Improving the fork sync function to include newly created branches

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to have the ability to select "view all" in Teams, Projects and Repositories on top menu bar.
fields.summary: "View all" options in Teams, Projects, Repositories

fields.description: I can add my aliases to bitbucket, however I am unable to add my users.noreply.github.com alias, because I am unable to verify it (github doesn't forward the email). Please add the ability to add a private github noreply address through github signin.
fields.summary: Add support for github noreply address

fields.description: Currently, we are not firing any webhooks after deleting a branch in the UI. This causes an inconsistency between deleting branches via git and in UI.
fields.summary: Webhook should fire after UI delete branch event

fields.description:
First, thanks for BCLOUD-7042

Now, when the branch of a pull-requests gets updated, all approvals get removed.\\
Now, as author of the pull-request, I have to look at the history to ping the people who approved before this change to re-approve the latest changes.

Our suggestion to fix this, is to add the people who approve  a PR to the list of reviewers. This way, after a change comes in, it's easy to keep track of who needs to re-approve.

EDIT: original request included commenters. After talking this over again, the main problem is when someone gives an approval on a PR, a new commit comes in, we have to look in the history of who approved the original PR to ask for re-approval.

It would be really nice if people who give their approval on a PR would be added to the list of 'reviewers' so we know who to poke for a re-approve after changing the PR

Staff edit:\\
Updating title to reflect how we would probably solve this (by notifying approvers instead of modifying the reviewers list).
fields.summary: Notify approvers when their approvals are invalidated

fields.description:
On wiki pages, using either #{number} or issue #{number} turns the issue number into a link to the issue.

Sometimes, mysteriously, these links will no longer appear on a wiki page. Evidently this happens once the page reaches a certain length.

Users might encounter this on, for example, a release history page with lists of issues, as the page grows over time.

At times, the Preview feature in edit mode will show the links, only to have them disappear once the page is saved.

Ideally, the links should appear on all pages regardless of their length. But, if that can't be done, it would be good to notify the user, in the user interface and documentation.
fields.summary: Issues are not linked on long wiki pages

fields.description:
As per https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/publishing-a-website-on-bitbucket-cloud-221449776.html , publishing webpage now returns 400 Bad request when special character is used as the username.

This was working before, and this sudden change is impacting user operations.
fields.summary: Publishing webpage returning 400 Bad request when special character is used as the username

fields.description:
When trying to compare between 2 branches, if the branches contain files which have mixed CRLF (Windows) and LF (Unix) line endings, instead of showing the diff in the compare page, the page errors out instead. The different line endings seems to be confusing git when generating the diff and this throws out the error page. This looks to be a git bug which should be fixed on git 2.10.

Example repo of where this issue is reproduced: [Link|https://bitbucket.org/bbain/git-broken-eof]

*Workaround:*

Make the line endings consistent in the affected files on the branches and push an update into the branches. Once that happens the diff (and merge) should work.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Compare function will show a 500 error if there are any files in the branches which have mixed have mixed CRLF (Windows) and LF (Unix) line endings

fields.description:
Sometimes I just need to park some code and don't want CI to run and use up minutes.

Currently the only way to manage that is to find a positive match for all branches I _do_ want to run (I can't see a documented way to _exclude_ a pattern).

I could do a positive match for the negative case (heh) for something like "donotmerge*" but even so, the build would show as green/successful rather than skipped (which is obviously risky).

So basically I'm looking for a way to tell Pipelines NOT to run for a particular branch or pattern; and I don't want Pipelines to show a "successful" build for that scenario. I do want some visibility of skipped builds as there's potential for people to over-use it - just as Bamboo shows skipped or stopped builds.
fields.summary: Skip / do-not-run mechanism for pipelines

fields.description: It would be nice to tell which step it taking the most time. Time taken should be in seconds.
fields.summary: Add elapsed time for each build step

fields.description:
How can I remove a credit card from my Bitbucket ???\\
Please help :-)
fields.summary: How do I remove the credit card for my Bitbucket

How can I remove a credit card from my Bitbucket ???\\
Please help :-)
fields.summary: How do I remove the credit card for my Bitbucket

fields.description: Give Pipelines the ability to deploy artifacts to Bitbucket Pages, as Gitlab does with their pipelines services, stated in [this page|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/pages/README.html].
fields.summary: Deploy artifacts to Bitbucket Pages

fields.description: !3309507022-bug111.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Request: The 'href' attribute should not be present as marked in the Version Info section.

fields.description: Some customers will want to move repositories to new accounts (say individual to team). At the moment, build history of the pipelines will not migrate to the new account.
fields.summary: Persist pipelines build history when repository is moved

fields.description:
I am writing to suggest an additional feature to the issue tracker in Bitbucket repositories.

Currently, the newest comments are placed at the bottom of the page. One therefore needs to scroll all the way to the bottom of the page to see the latest comments. It would be nice if there was an option to sort the comments with newest at the top of the page, if one wishes to order them in that way.
fields.summary: Sort the comment from newest to oldest in Issue tracker

fields.description: Currently, it is needed to refresh the page to enable the merge button, once a pull request has been initiated and waited upon approval.
fields.summary: Automatically update the merge button's state without a page refresh
Don't ignore white space in string literals in diff display

fields.description:
I have a repository with a WordPress website in. When cloning the repository to a live server all the file permissions have been changed meaning access to sub directories like /wp-admin are showing the following error message:

A file permissions error has occurred. Please check the permissions on the script and the directory it is in and try again.

The site works fine locally but after committing it and then cloning it, the file permissions have been changed.
fields.summary: File permissions on clone

fields.description:
I opened a pull request today, added a number of comments to a number of files and then pushed a change to one of the files. While I did expect comments on this specific files, on lines that had changed, to be marked as outdated, I did not expect *all* my comments, on *all* files, to become outdated (and therefore hidden). This is terribly annoying as it means reviewers now need to open the Activity tab to see the old comments, instead of having them in line with the code. Am I missing something or is this a bug?

I'm aware of [this similar issue|BCLOUD-8397], but my scenario is slightly different in that I did make a change to one of the files (although it may be the same root cause?).

[Here's a link|https://bitbucket.org/IGI_Software/graph.implementation/pull-requests/255/pc-plot-rendering-lines-part-2-2-adding/diff] to the pull request (it's private, but hopefully you can access it).

Cheers,

Remi
fields.summary: All pull request comments get outdated when pushing new changes (Mercurial repo)

fields.description: It would be great we have a deploy section in pipelines-bitbucket.yml, with deployment settings (shell scripts are ugly today for this purposes)
fields.summary: Can we have a better Deploy section for Pipelines?

fields.description: The Yaml validator from Pipelines doesn't look reliable. Could we have a better config-validator for Pipelines which would check if there's some syntax error on bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and pop up a warning about that before the build run?
fields.summary: Better YAML validator for Pipelines configuration

fields.description: It would be good we have predefined environment variable 'BITBUCKET_TAG', which will be set only for tag-build
fields.summary: Pipeline tags

fields.description:
I just tried cloning a bitbucket repo and received these within a few minutes of each other:

{code}
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@       WARNING: POSSIBLE DNS SPOOFING DETECTED!          @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
The RSA host key for bitbucket.org has changed,
and the key for the corresponding IP address 104.192.143.3
is unknown. This could either mean that
DNS SPOOFING is happening or the IP address for the host
and its host key have changed at the same time.
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@    WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!     @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!
Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
It is also possible that a host key has just been changed.
The fingerprint for the RSA key sent by the remote host is
SHA256:7eDcNTsnQUbykSsrDYGKwMvPOnFbwL4j4U/BY1qVocs.
{code}

{code}
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@    WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!     @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!
Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)!
It is also possible that a host key has just been changed.
The fingerprint for the RSA key sent by the remote host is
SHA256:7eDcNTsnQUbykSsrDYGKwMvPOnFbwL4j4U/BY1qVocs.
{code}

My {{known_hosts}} file shows the same key fingerprints as https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-the-ssh-protocol-with-bitbucket-cloud-221449711.html#UsetheSSHprotocolwithBitbucketCloud-KnownhostorBitbucket%27spublickeyfingerprints

Are you changing keys or is something amiss?
fields.summary: SSH host key changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If user in the Team's user group doesn't have any Team permission (Create repositories and Administer Team), the user will not able to view their team under the Teams (Top Navigation bar)

h3. Notes
To view their team under the Team Navigation bar, the User Group must at least granted with *Create Repositories* permission.

Report which related to Team Permission issue: BCLOUD-13296
fields.summary: User Group without permissions in Team is unable to view their Team under Teams Menu

fields.description:
Hello,\\
We are interested in using Bitbucket Pipeline Service, but first we want to\\
get some doubts about the pipeline. Today we run 6.000 deploys per year.\\
Exists any limitation of builds?\\
How many concurrent deployments?\\
Considering our volume of deploys, exist any additional cost?
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipeline - concurrent builds

The saving Icon keep spinning after clicking save in Team's User Group.\\
!962232619-SaveUserGroup.gif|thumbnail!

# Select Any Group

###Workaround\\
Refresh the User Group Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Now read-only users are able to upload arbitrary file by using _Add files_ button at Downloads page, however they cannot delete their uploaded file.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Prohibit read-only users to upload file
* Make users available to delete their own uploaded files even they don't have a write privilege

h3. Workaround
There's no workaround except asking repository owner or Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Read-only users cannot delete their uploaded files

fields.description:
I have this comment added to my code.

This issue seems to be related with [PR-282](Link https://bitbucket.org/kristingreen/studio-manager-web/pull-requests/282/teacher-lessons-gridview/diff)

Instead of pointing to PR-282, the link points to the same url (https://bitbucket.org/kristingreen/studio-manager-web/pull-requests/281/lesson-review-showall/diff)  as PR I'm working on
fields.summary: Link points to incorrect url when referring to pull requests in comment

fields.description:
It would make the life of many developers easier if on the Pull Request page there was a link/button to pull the branch being tested.

I'm envisioning something on the top right beside the "Merge" button or under the ... dropdown (that contains "Edit", "Decline" and "Unwatch") that would allow the user to pull the branch directly (to Sourcetree).
fields.summary: Pull Request page should have a link to pull the branch being tested
Pipeline log preview should show tail not the begging of the log

fields.description:
Customer Request:

bq. Bitbucket Cloud suggest using Authy for 2FA, thus it would be very nice if Bitbucket was registered in Authy. This would allow users to have the Bitbucket icon and sort accounts more easily.\\
To do so, Authy's(https://www.authy.com/) workflow is simple: the company (you in this case) needs to contact them asking to be added and that's it.


BBS-44160
fields.summary: Add Bitbucket Cloud icon to Authy

fields.description:
It will be best that Bitbucket API 2.0 supports SSH-keys which previously introduce in Bitbucket API 1.0\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/ssh-keys-resource-296911735.html
fields.summary: Support ssh-keys resources in Bitbucket API 2.0

fields.description:
According to your OAuth documentation, "We support all 4 of RFC-6749's grant flows to obtain access tokens". However, when a user has two-factor authentication enabled on their account, the "Resource Owner Password Credentials" grant type does not work. The following error is returned.

{ error_description: 'Cannot use password grant for accounts with two step verification enabled.',\\
error: 'invalid_request' }

Other providers get around this by accepting the two-factor OTP either through an additional field, or a custom HTTP header, and it would be great if Bitbucket.org could do the same.

As more users are becoming more security conscious, this is starting to become a real blocker for 3rd party app developers. At the moment our only options are to try to shoe-horn a web interface to use the "Authorization Code" grant type, or to request that the user temporarily disable two-factor authentication. Neither of those are great options.
fields.summary: Support Two-Factor via OAuth

fields.description:
_Apologies if this is one that has been raised before, I searched but couldn't find it..._

h2. Proposal
I would like to suggest showing "master" as a labelled branch in the Commits view.

h3. More info
In the Commits view (left-hand menu) and when All is selected, branches and tags are shown against their respective commits. It would be useful (to me at least) if "master" could also be shown as a label. Currently I have to either work out which is the latest commit that doesn't have a label, or I have to select master as the visible branch, find the commit history and then switch back to All and search for the commit ID.

I've left it at the default Major. I think it would it would be a useful change :)
fields.summary: Show label for master in commits/history view

fields.description: When I enable pipelines for a repository that already has bitbucket-pipelines.yml file on some branches, pipeline builds for such branches are not automatically started.  To start them, I need to do fake commit to each of such branches.  There should be some way to trigger pipeline build without commit.  If for some branch pipeline build was already performed at least once, there is "rerun" button in the results of last pipeline build, but in my case the branches were never built, so "rerun" button is not available.
fields.summary: There should be a way to trigger pipeline build without commit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bitbucket Cloud load file changes from the top to bottom.\\
If there's a file with huge changes is listed in the middle of the list, the following files (even file with small changes) will not load.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great that Bitbucket Cloud able to detect files with small changes and display it first.\\
And only display "Oops! You've got a lot of code in this diff and it couldn't load with the page. Click here to give it another chance." on files with huge changes.
fields.summary: Ability to first load files with small changes on Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Commit Page displayed the new folder's name incorrectly after renaming an existing folder by adding characters at the end of the existing name.

For an example:\\
Output from terminal

{code}
#!python

$ git commit -m "Renamed Folders"
[master 8ba3e24] Renamed Folders
 3 files changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)
 rename {Image => ImageC}/test2 (100%)
 rename {Test => TestFolder}/test1 (100%)
 rename {SampleFolder => RenamedFolder}/sample (100%)

{code}

Commit Page displayed as

{code}
#!python

Image/ { → } /test2
Test/ { → older } /test1
{ SampleFolder → RenamedFolder } /sample

{code}

Sample Image:\\
!1284687174-CommitPageRenamed.PNG|thumbnail!

###Steps to Reproduce

# Renamed a folder by adding characters at the end of the existing name. (eg. Test => Test1)
# Make a commit and push to the remote repository.

###Actual Results

{code}
#!python

{ Image → ImageC} /test2
{ Test → TestFolder } /test1
{ SampleFolder → RenamedFolder } /sample

{code}
fields.summary: Commit Page displayed folder's name incorrectly after renamed

fields.description: While pipilines duration limited for each month, will be good to see total used time in current month
fields.summary: Total pipelines duration time

fields.description:
Similar to this 1st Bitbucket Server feature mentioned here:

https://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/07/new-features-bitbucket-4-8/
fields.summary: Commit-level review

fields.description:
When you create a new repository and you are starting from scratch, on the old instructions it said git init however on the new instructions, you are asked to clone the repo so I had no reference to origin when I tried to push.

I think you need to specify that in your instructions. It is not very clear that the .git file is now in the repo that you have just clone and that you must move your parent directory into the cloned repo in order to push.
fields.summary: Customer Request: New "I'm starting from scratch" instruction is not clear.

fields.description: Often I want to watch the progression of a build without necessarily seeing the gory details.  When looking at a pipeline build, I'd like to be able to see which command is executing without seeing the output of the command.  If the command fails, that's when the output becomes interesting, and users could then click on the command to see the output.
fields.summary: Don't display log of individual pipeline commands until the user clicks on a command

fields.description: Often I want to watch the progression of a build without necessarily seeing the gory details.  When looking at a pipeline build, I'd like to be able to see which command is executing without seeing the output of the command.  If the command fails, that's when the output becomes interesting, and users could then click on the command to see the output.
fields.summary: Don't display log of individual pipeline commands until the user clicks on a command

fields.description:
We like to keep commit history linear, so it would be really nice to see directly from pull request if it is on top of destination branch and prevent merging if it was not.

Branches where merges that are not directly to top of branch could be listed in "Branch Management" settings.

See: BCLOUD-12053
fields.summary: Option to not allow merge unless source branch is rebased on top of destination

fields.description: When a branch or pull request diff contains a large number of image files, JS is being loaded  and executed multiple times for each image on the diff, which creates a pretty large memory and performance impact on diffs containing a lot of images -- and causing the browser to freeze and crash.
fields.summary: Trying to view a branch/pull request diff with a large amount of image files creates a pretty large memory and performance impact, causing the browser to freeze or crash (BBCDEV-3604)

fields.description:
It would be nice if, in the event of a failed webdriver build for instance, i could run a command along the lines of

$ upload-artifact path/to/screenshot.png

in my build script, and have pipelines surface that screenshot on the build page, to the left of or possibly even inline with my build log.

I did see https://bitbucket.org/awslabs/amazon-s3-bitbucket-pipelines-python but we're not currently using AWS so this is a lot of effort to set up.
fields.summary: Provide a simple way to store build artifacts (e.g. Webdriver screenshots) and surface them in the Pipelines UI

fields.description:
In Bamboo on the main page for a plan there is a nice corner with some metadata:

!447727649-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

At present, our build times in Pipelines are all over the place as we get used to the platform, as the platform changes, and as our builds change. To address issues like [this one|BCLOUD-13491] we'd need to be able to tell "how long is too long", which right now is a difficult question to answer. Metrics I would personally find either useful or interesting:

* Average build time (over different periods, bonus point if it could be given on a per-branch basis)
* Longest successful build
* Shortest successful build
* Average queue time (is this relevant for Pipelines? Builds seem to start much faster than Bamboo)
* Number of builds since last failure
* Successful build ratio

End goal is to make meaningful improvements in build time, right now it's hard to say whether we're doing that or not. On one project, for example, our successful builds vary from 19 minutes to over an hour and it's not clear what's driving that.
fields.summary: Show build metadata (avg build time, success ratio)

fields.description:
It would be useful to add write access to a repo only for build status, so there is no access to repos, or user deletion, pushing commits, etc.

With third party CI tools, we need write status over a repo, but in the event of it being compromised, this could lead to unintended access over the entire repo. If we can segment out build status only, this would help prevent these scenarios.
fields.summary: Allow write access only for "Build status"

fields.description:
Certain tools, such as Jenkins webhooks, rely on having the correct outbound IP for Bitbucket.org. Being able to automate updating these tools in the event of an IP change would be very helpful.

If the outbound IP can be returned via a call to an API endpoint, this data can be retrieved programmatically as opposed to manually accessing a Confluence page.
fields.summary: Please provide an API endpoint that returns Bitbucket.org's outbound IP

fields.description: How to remove a repository?
fields.summary: Please wait a moment while we create your repository

fields.description:
Steps to Replicate :

# Navigate to a Repository
# In the left menu, Navigate to "Navigation / Overview"
# Click in the button "Send invitation" at the top / right
# Fill an account and share the account
# Send the invitation
fields.summary: Sending Invitation multiple times spams notification alert.

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

# Create a branch with name x
# Delete the branch
# Create a branch so the branch name is x/*

My specific name for the branch was release and I tried to later create a branch with the name release/1.2.6

I then got the error that the branch name is invalid.
fields.summary: Can't create branch that has deleted branch as first path segment

fields.description:
Scenario:

* Pull Request has changes to two files A and B
* reviewer puts a comment on file A
* developer commits and pushes an update to file B
* now the Pull Request hides the comment on file A. It can only be seen when clicking the link for comments on previous versions of this file.

This seems unnecessary: the file A hasn't changed so the comment isn't on a previous version. Instead the comment should continue to be displayed in the main area unless that file has been changed. Even better, keep the comment there unless the line that was commented on has been changed (or perhaps lines near to that line are changed).
fields.summary: Don't hide comments as against 'previous versions' unless that file was changed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In _Commits_ page of a repository, the field _Author_ shows the Bitbucket user the following way:\\
The commit author's email is checked, to see if it matches a confirmed email of a Bitbucket user. If it does, this user appears as author of the commits.

Sometimes users have in their .gitconfig file an email different than their Bitbucket account email.\\
In this case, no Bitbucket user shows as Author.\\
Additionally, users may accidentally use someone else's email in their .gitconfig (e.g. using a different laptop), and the commits they push show an author different than themselves.

Repo admins/owners would like to be able to see which user pushed a commit in Bitbucket, in order to track a commit to the user that pushed it.

h3. Suggested Solution
In _Commits_ page of a repo, add a column that shows which Bitbucket user pushed each commit.
fields.summary: As a repo admin I want to see which user pushed each commit in my repo - Customer request

fields.description:
In a team accounts team can have multiple repositories, categorized into 'projects'. Users - especially team/project leaders need to know about changes in multiple repositories within same project (or even within whole bitbucket 'team' account). Currently those users need to edit notification subscriptions one-by-one; however it would be helpful to be able to subscribe to all in one project.

As an example - in our team we have over 100 repositories - subscribing to all of those can be obviously very time-consuming task.
fields.summary: Ability to subscribe to notifications of multiple repositories

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1.)Create "bitbucket" database on a SQL 2016 instance (named instance in this test):

CREATE DATABASE bitbucket\\
GO\\
USE bitbucket\\
GO\\
ALTER DATABASE bitbucket SET ALLOW_SNAPSHOT_ISOLATION ON\\
GO\\
ALTER DATABASE bitbucket SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON\\
GO\\
ALTER DATABASE bitbucket COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS\\
GO\\
SET NOCOUNT OFF\\
GO\\
USE master\\
GO\\
CREATE LOGIN bitbucketuser WITH PASSWORD=N'blahblah', DEFAULT_DATABASE=bitbucket, CHECK_EXPIRATION=OFF, CHECK_POLICY=OFF\\
GO\\
ALTER AUTHORIZATION ON DATABASE::bitbucket TO bitbucketuser\\
GO

2.)Retrieve and launch latest Bitbucket Docker image:

docker run --privileged=true -v /stage/bitbucket:/var/atlassian/application-data/bitbucket --name="bitbucket" -d -p 80:7990 -p 7999:7999 atlassian/bitbucket-server

3.)Create a bitbucket.properties file under $BITBUCKET_HOME/shared to allow the use of a SQL Server named instanced:

tee /stage/bitbucket/shared/bitbucket.properties <<-'EOF'\\
jdbc.driver=com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver\\
jdbc.url=jdbc:sqlserver://INNO-JFWINAPP01.eagleinvsys.com\SQL2016;databaseName=bitbucket\\
jdbc.user=bitbucketuser\\
jdbc.password=blahblah\\
EOF

4.)Upon launching the UI, the database schema/object rollout from Liquidbase will fail with locking issues (see attached log).
fields.summary: Latest Bitbucket Docker image unable to roll out to SQL 2016 database due to locking issues

fields.description: Bitbucket.org does not adapt to the available viewport. The minimum browser width to avoid horizontal scrolling is 1024 pixels. That doesn't seem reasonable. Please modify the site to better support Responsive Web Design principles.
fields.summary: Responsive Web Design

fields.description:
Issue BCLOUD-13276\\
!4030732462-Issue.PNG|thumbnail!

When I tried to Create a HTML file in my repo, and commit it online from the Bitbucket UI, I received an error message 'We had trouble committing your changes.' check the Pic.

In addition, please perceive that the Commit button don't recognize the pasted text, when you just past text into the text area of the editor the Commit button will remain inactive unless after pasting, you pressed Enter or add something by Keyboard.

*Thanks a lot in advance.*
fields.summary: Error when trying to commit change using the online editor

fields.description: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/pagination has wrong HTML formatting in "previous" row of the table.
fields.summary: Wrong HTML formatting

fields.description:
I know that pipelines is doing some caching of docker images but it doesn't seem to be reliable. For example i ran our build once and it took a couple of minutes to download our image, i ran it a second time a few minutes later and it took 25 minutes to download the image. This is a major bottleneck especially considering the fact that there are a limited number of build minutes.

This is similar to BCLOUD-12818, but that is more focused on saving dependencies after the fact, whereas the bottleneck i'm describing is in downloading the docker image itself.
fields.summary: Better caching of the docker build image

fields.description:
Hello,\\
last week I made a request in Atlassian Site https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-43672 and Jesse Yowell recommended me to make the feature request in this page. So here is the description of the problem:

It is kind of difficult to notice the differences between white spaces and tabs, because in the "Diff to previous" section the tabs are represented with white spaces. Is there a way to change the view of tabs representation?

Regards,\\
Medina, Ricardo
fields.summary: Distinguish tab and space characters in diffs

fields.description:
At https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html there is described "issue:comment_created" payload. The payload includes data about repository, issue, and comment.

Both issue and comment have ID.

It is unclear from your documentation, whether to identify a particular comment, I need only comment ID or both comment ID and issue ID. Or do we need to know also the repository among two IDs, to identify a particular comment?

Please correct your documentation (for issue comments, pull request comments, and for commit comments, and probably other kinds of entities).
fields.summary: API webhooks documentation is unclear

fields.description: Have multiple callback URLs option so that it does not need to be manually edited.
fields.summary: Have multiple callback URLs in Oauth Consumer

fields.description:
Reproducible docker builds use Git LFS to store binary files instead of downloading them in the net always (as it happens, e.g. Oracle JDK download is did not work last week).

Pipelines does not support building docker containers directly, but we use a hack that a pipeline creates a tar.gz and sends that file somewhere else to be build. Now we noticed, that pipelines git command does not support LFS, and we'd have to use complicated hacks to make it work with AWS ECR custom images.

The combination of lack of Git LFS and Docker container support makes us to consider something more improved like GitLabs CI, or even AWS code commit.
fields.summary: Pipelines should support Git LFS

fields.description:
Currently, only "team admin" members can see and know who are in "user groups".   In our team, non-admin team member should know that.  There are several reasons such as:

* We assigned "create repository" privilege to only user groups called "create repository".  Member want to know who can create repositories.

So, please implement functionality that non-admin team member see and know who are in the user groups.
fields.summary: Team member want to know who are in each "User groups"

fields.description: If an invalid file is dragged onto the avatar upload dialog, an error is shown.  If a valid file is subsequently dragged onto the dialog, it will show up but clicking "Save" doesn't do anything.  Refreshing the page and retrying with the valid file works as expected.
fields.summary: Unable to save valid project avatar if invalid file is tried first

fields.description:
When specifying nested lists, there is extra space rendered immediately above the child point(s) that follow a given 'parent' item. This is visually confusing in the case that – if another non-subordinate point appears _after_ the child points – there is no intervening space before the original level of indentation is resumed and the list proceeds. This style gives the impression spatially that the child points belong in a grouping with the _next sibling_ after their actual parent, since they are spaced farther away from the parent item than with its next sibling.

Subordinate lists should appear _*either:*_ with equal amounts of vertical spacing above and below _*or:*_ with _less_ spacing above and _more_ below, to give the impression of child items being grouped with the parent item, rather than with the following sibling item.

I have confirmed this applies to both Firefox 49 and Internet Explorer 11. Most browsers are presumably affected. Prefixing lists with a {{tab}}-character instead of 4 {{space}}s has no effect on rendering.

h2. Sample:
As an addendum, naming conventions which imply _*purpose*_ (as opposed to type) should still be acceptable as per our current conventions:

* using _*singular*_ noun-phrases for relations which accept [CRUD|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Create%2C_read%2C_update_and_delete]-operations
* using _*plural*_ noun-phrases to describe relations which:

** exist for display-purposes
** _*may*_ or _*may not*_ accept CRUD-operations
* using the {{_cache}} suffix for relations which are _*not*_ human-reader friendly which store the results of intensive computations and do not **logically** allow CRUD-operations since they represent a digest of information from various tables which would not make sense to edit directly. Such caches should be accessed using a function both to decrease coupling to specific relations, and to give database-users the option to avoid using the cache if they require guaranteed-up-to-date information.

h2. Sample source:
{code:markdown}
As an addendum, naming conventions which imply ***purpose*** (as opposed to type) should still be acceptable as per our current conventions:

* using ***singular*** noun-phrases for relations which accept [CRUD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Create,_read,_update_and_delete)-operations
* using ***plural*** noun-phrases to describe relations which:
    * exist for display-purposes
    * ***may*** or ***may not*** accept CRUD-operations
* using the `_cache` suffix for relations which are ***not*** human-reader friendly which store the results of intensive computations and do not **\*logically\*** allow CRUD-operations since they represent a digest of information from various tables which would not make sense to edit directly. Such caches should be accessed using a function both to decrease coupling to specific relations, and to give database-users the option to avoid using the cache if they require guaranteed-up-to-date information.
{code}

h2. Problem CSS:
The style that's causing this in the main issue-body is a line from {{vendor.css}} which applies to {{<ul>}} elements:

{code:css}
.aui-group, .aui-panel, .aui-tabs,
blockquote, dl, form.aui, h1, h2, 
h3, h4, h5, h6, ol, p, pre,
table.aui, ul {
    margin: 10px 0 0;
}
{code}
fields.summary: Markdown styling - nasty-looking spacing when using nested lists in main issue-description in tracker

fields.description:
We've got some extremely slow performance with rspec tests and mariadb in a docker context, and it would be useful to try making use of a tmpfs directory to speed things up.

I know this is something that can't be done within a docker container without launching it with special admin privileges, which we can't control from within the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file, but maybe something can be made available on your end, with a special option to make use of it in that yaml file.
fields.summary: Make tmpfs / ramdisk available within container

fields.description:
This issue is related to a "resolve" option request on top-level pull request comments.

A common scenario for my front-end team is to leave top-level screenshots of ideas or comments about improvements/bugs in a pull request. Rather than leave a comment on a specific line, we'll post a general screenshot (which auto-posts to slack) and either discuss it on the PR or Slack. When the PR as been updated with a fix, we would love to be able to hit a "Resolve" or "Mark as Complete" button.

The resolved comments could then be greyed out or have a green checkmark beside them to indicate completion. When all comments have been resolved, we can feel confident in approving/merging.
fields.summary: Resolve PR Comments

fields.description: Allow custom storage for BitBucket Pipelines (For example, Amazon S3) instead of using BitBucket media storage for Git LFS files.
fields.summary: Git-LFS S3 Upload with Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description: I'm using your API (v2) to generate statistics across many PRs. I noticed you don't provide a closed_on field in the pull requests API (in either the list or detail endpoints). It would be great if we could have this field on the PR.
fields.summary: Add close date on API output for Pull Request

fields.description:
Getting while doing\\
git push -u origin master
fields.summary: error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 100

fields.description: When you change the selector in the upper left corner (branches, tags) of the Commit view from a branch to a tag (or vice versa) the icon isn't updated. When you refresh the hole page the icoon is updated though. See also the images; master is a branch, deniable is a tag. Or see the screencast (page is refreshed when the screen is 'flashing').
fields.summary: Icon branches/tag in Commits view doesn't change

fields.description:
n the given url\\
https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<username>/api

how would i give multiple callback urls one for development one for staging and one for production

Currently the callback url is forced to be changed manually everytime i need.

Please provide ways to validate multiple callback urls.
fields.summary: Adding Multiple Callback url for OAuth Consumer Application

fields.description:
Due to specific conditions, it is possible to merge more than one pull request. See this example:

# Make some commits on a branch B and create a PR1 from B->A but don't merge it yet
# Merge branch B into another branch C, make some new commits to branch C (possibly undoing the original commits on branch B)
# Create a PR2 from branch C->A and accept/merge it.
# PR1 will automatically be merged as well, because technically all its commits are within PR2.

It would be useful to have the following:

A) Show a warning message that two PRs are going to be merged at the same time, to prevent the confusion that arose.\\
B) Explain a manual copy method of cherry-picking commits to fix unintended consequences of a merge (may need to be a separate guide to refer to)
fields.summary: Advanced PR checks

fields.description:
*Summary*

* In order to check the total commits done in a project, it needs to be checked in every repository.

*Suggestion*

* To provide a counter to all commits done in a project.
fields.summary: Include total number of commits in a project

fields.description:
It's better to have a team repository URL that includes the project slug, for example:

https://bitbucket.org/username/projectname/repositoryname

Rather than just:

https://bitbucket.org/username/repositoryname

This will help users to better organize and group their repositories.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Project slug as part of the team repository URL.

fields.description:
"Issues" in the navigation defaults to show only new and open issues, but "Issues" in the breadcrumbs (in a specific issue page) does not. It would be nice for both to show only new and open issues.

For example, this link in this picture:

!314468238-issues.png|thumbnail!

Instead of it leading to:

https://bitbucket.org/username/repositoryname/issues

It'll be nice to lead to:

https://bitbucket.org/username/repositoryname/issues?status=new&status=open
fields.summary: Customer request: "Issues" breadcrumb to default to show only new and open issues

fields.description: From both the /user/ and the /dashboard/repositories view, there is a column called "Last Update" that shows a time in text -- ie, 20 minutes ago. To see the updates, one has to click the reponame which loads a new page, then click the commits button on the left. It would be useful to make that last updated time into a link to reponame/commits/all. That would make getting to the commits list much faster, and it would not further clutter the dashboard view (that is, no additional columns or text to add, just adjusting some inactive text into a link).
fields.summary: Make last updated time in dashboard into a link to reponame/commit/all

fields.description: On the dashboard overview where you have Pull Requests "Waiting on your review" you cannot see the repository the PR relates to, which can be confusing if the branch names are ambiguous.
fields.summary: Show repository name next to Pull Requests on Dashboard Overview

fields.description:
This is a follow up bug report from the outcome of the discussion in issue BCLOUD-13311

here is our workflow...

# git clone git@bitbucket.org:yooture/dummy.git (done by dev on local env)
# cd dummy  (done by dev on local env)
# git checkout -b feature/FF  (done by dev on local env)
# echo "Dany" >> contributors.txt  (done by dev on local env)
# git commit -am "dany"  (done by dev on local env)
# git push origin feature/FF  (done by dev on local env)
# create PR for "feature/FF" via Bitbucket WebUI (check "Close feature/FF after the pull request is merged")  (done by dev in browser)
# git checkout master  (done by dev on local env)
# git merge feature/FF  (done by dev on local env)
# git push origin master  (done by dev on local env)
# git fetch origin --prune  (done by dev on local env)
# git branch -r  (done by dev on local env)

--> origin/feature/FF still exists

also if I do a fresh clone and list all the existing branches, feature/FF is still available...

all this is done on the origin organisation in Bitbucket (no fork is involved)

So from what was discussed with @kelwert in BCLOUD-13311, I would expect the repo "feature/FF" to be deleted after I pushed my merge commit - this seems clearly a bug on Bitbucket site then.
fields.summary: Delete the ref based on the 'close' checkbox when a user merges locally

fields.description:
"View" URL is wrong when trying to add an additional user to any group that would have taken user beyond the 5 user limit of the free plan:

!632826926-bug.png|thumbnail!

It should include a username between two slashes in the URL, instead of a "//".
fields.summary: "View" URL is wrong when trying to add an additional user to any group that would have taken user beyond the 5 user limit of the free plan

fields.description:
I would like to have the issue described in BCLOUD-12797 reconsidered. While the solution provided is great, it does not help when using README files outside of Bitbucket.

One such use case is using the README contents as a long description for python packages on https://pypi.python.org/pypi.

e.g. https://pypi.python.org/pypi/chalice/0.4.0 (with badge) vs https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sippycup/0.1.0 (without badge)

Having the build status on a project's summary page that is created directly from the README would be a nice addition.
fields.summary: Provide project status / build status badges to embeddable image outside of Bitbucket

fields.description: It would be nice we we could test the status builds in a Pull Request before we merge it. Something like a --dry-run option.
fields.summary: Test a Pull request before merge
